analyzed: saṃpreṣitāḥ loka vināyakebhiḥ deśehi saddharmam udāram uttamam
translated: Sent by the guides of the world, teach the sublime, excellent, true Dharma.

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān mañjuśriyam kumāra bhūtam etat avocat

analyzed: sādhu khalu punar tvam mañjuśrīḥ tathāgatam etam artham paripraṣṭavyam manyase
translated: It is excellent that you think to ask the Tathāgata about this matter.

translated: Mañjuśrī, you are engaged in the welfare of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the sake of the great multitude,

original: hitāya sukhāya devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ caitarhy āgatānāṃ ca bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ
analyzed: hitāya sukhāya devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca etarhi āgatānām ca bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām

analyzed: buddha bhūmi prāpaṇa artham

original: anuttrāsas te mañjuśrīr asmin sthāne yogaḥ karaṇīyo na

analyzed: bhayam na stambhita tvam
translated: without terror or timidity.

analyzed: jñāna pratisaraṇena ca te mañjuśrīḥ bhavitavyam
translated: Mañjuśrī, you should rely on wisdom.

analyzed: tathāgatasya etam artham nirdeśataḥ
translated: This is the explanation of the Tathāgata's meaning.

analyzed: anutpādaḥ nirodhaḥ iti mañjuśrīḥ tathāgatasya etat adhivacanam
translated: Non-arising and non-cessation, Mañjuśrī, are a designation for the Tathāgata.

original: tadyathā mañjuśrīr iyaṃ mahāpṛthivī mahāvaiḍūryamayī saṃsthitā bhavet /
analyzed: tat yathā mañjuśrīḥ iyam mahā pṛthivī mahā vaiḍūrya mayī saṃsthitā bhavet
translated: It is just as, Mañjuśrī, this great earth were to become a great beryl.

original: evaṃ ca saṃsthitā bhaved yathā tasyāṃ vaiḍūryamayāṃ mahāpṛthivyāṃ trayastriṃśadbhavanasya /
analyzed: evam ca saṃsthitā bhavet yathā tasyām vaiḍūrya mayām mahā pṛthivyām trayastriṃśat bhavanasya
translated: And it were to be arranged like this: just as in that great beryl earth, the abode of the Thirty-Three,

analyzed: śakrasya devānām indrasya
translated: of Śakra, Lord of the Gods,

analyzed: vaijayantasya ca prāsādasya pratibhāsaḥ saṃdṛśyet
translated: and the palace Vaijayanta would be seen reflected.

original: śakraś ca devānām indras tatra divyaiḥ pañcabhiḥ kāmaguṇaiḥ krīḍan ramamāṇaḥ paricārayan saṃdṛśyet /

translated: And Śakra, Lord of the Gods, would be seen there, playing, enjoying, and amusing himself with the divine five sense objects,

analyzed: atha tasmin samaye devāḥ sarva jambūdvīpakāḥ strī puruṣa dāraka dārikāḥ saṃcodayeyuḥ

analyzed: āgacchatha bho nara nāryaḥ
translated: Come, gentlemen and ladies!

original: paśyatemaṃ śakraṃ devānām indraṃ vaijayante prāsāde divyaiḥ pañcabhiḥ kāmaguṇaiḥ krīḍantaṃ ramantaṃ paricārayantam /

translated: Look at Śakra, Lord of the Gods, playing, enjoying, and amusing himself with the divine five sense objects in the palace Vaijayanta.

analyzed: āgacchatha bho nara nāri gaṇāḥ
translated: Come, multitudes of men and women!

analyzed: dānāni dadata puṇyāni kuruta
translated: Give gifts and make merit.

analyzed: śīlam ca samādāya vartayata
translated: And having taken up morality, you should live by it.

original: īdṛśeṣu vaijayanteṣu prāsādeṣu krīḍiṣyatha ramiṣyatha paricārayiṣyatha śakratvāni ca kariṣyatha /
analyzed: īdṛśeṣu vaijayanteṣu prāsādeṣu krīḍiṣyatha ramiṣyatha paricārayiṣyatha śakra tvāni ca kariṣyatha
translated: In such Vaijayanta palaces you will play, enjoy yourselves, and amuse yourselves, and you will become like Shakra.

analyzed: īdṛśyā ca riddhyā samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyatha
translated: And you will be endowed with such prosperity.

original: atha mañjuśrīs te strīpuruṣadārakadārikās tasyāṃ vaiḍūryamayāṃ mahāpṛthivyāṃ trayastriṃśadbhavanasya /
analyzed: atha mañjuśrīḥ te strī puruṣa dāraka dārikāḥ tasyām vaiḍūrya mayām mahā pṛthivyām trayastriṃśat bhavanasya
translated: in the palace of the Thirty-Three,

analyzed: vaijayantasya prāsādasya
translated: in the Vaijayanta palace,

translated: having seen the reflection of Shakra, the lord of the gods, with palms joined,

translated: they would scatter flowers

analyzed: gandhān ca kṣiperan evam vācam bhāṣante  vayam api evaṃrūpāḥ bhavema yādṛśaḥ śakraḥ devānām indraḥ
translated: and scatter perfumes, speaking thus:🔽May we also become like Shakra, the lord of the gods.

original: vayam apy evaṃ vaijayante prāsāde krīḍema ramema parivārayema yathāyaṃ śakro devānām indra iti /
analyzed: vayam api evam vaijayante prāsāde krīḍema ramema parivārayema yathā ayam śakraḥ devānām indraḥ iti
translated: May we also play, enjoy ourselves, and amuse ourselves in such a Vaijayanta palace as Shakra, the lord of the gods.

original: na ca te sattvā evaṃ saṃjānanti sma /🔽pratibhāso 'yaṃ vaiḍūryamayāṃ mahāpṛthivyāṃ yatra trayastriṃśadbhavanam /
analyzed: na ca te sattvāḥ evam saṃjānanti sma  pratibhāsaḥ yam vaiḍūrya mayām mahā pṛthivyām yatra trayastriṃśat bhavanam
translated: And those beings do not know that this is an appearance.

analyzed: vaijayantaḥ ca prāsādaḥ
translated: This is an appearance of the abode of the Thirty-Three and the Vaijayanta palace on the great earth made of lapis lazuli.

analyzed: śakraḥ ca devānām indraḥ pariśuddha tvāt mahā vaiḍūryasya pratibhāsaḥ saṃdṛśyate iti

translated: Just as, Manjushri, there is no abode of the Thirty-Three there on the great earth made of lapis lazuli,

analyzed: na vaijayantaḥ ca prāsādaḥ

analyzed: na ca śakraḥ devānām indraḥ
translated: and no Shakra, lord of the gods,

analyzed: api tu pariśuddha tvāt mahāvaiḍūryasya saṃdṛśyate trayastriṃśat bhavanam
translated: but due to the purity of the great lapis lazuli, the abode of the Thirty-Three,

analyzed: vaijayantaḥ ca prāsādaḥ
translated: the Vaijayanta palace,

analyzed: śakrasya devānām indraḥ
translated: and Shakra, lord of the gods, are seen.

original: sa cāsan notpanno na niruddhaḥ pariśuddhatvād mahāvaiḍūryasya pratibhāsaḥ saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: sa ca āsan na utpannaḥ na niruddhaḥ pariśuddha tvāt mahā vaiḍūryasya pratibhāsaḥ saṃdṛśyate
translated: And that [reflection] does not exist, is not produced, and does not cease. It is seen due to the purity of the great beryl.

translated: And he is not real, not produced, not ceased, not an existent, not a non-existent, not visible, not invisible, not worldly, not not worldly, not a shrine, not not a shrine, not existent, not non-existent.

analyzed: evam ca vācam bhāṣante
translated: And they speak these words:

analyzed: vayam api evaṃrūpāḥ bhavema yādṛśaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ iti

analyzed: te buddha jñāna abhilāṣiṇaḥ dānāni ca dadati

analyzed: śīlam ca samādāya vartante
translated: They undertake and abide by moral conduct.

analyzed: tat ca kuśala mūlam tathāgata jñāna pratilambhāya
translated: and that wholesome action for the attainment of the Tathāgata's knowledge,

analyzed: tena khalu punar mañjuśrīḥ samayena tasyāḥ adṛśyāḥ arūpiṇyāḥ akalpyāyāḥ avikalpāyāḥ cakṣuḥ patha samatikrāntāyāḥ

translated: And at that time, Shakra, lord of the gods, having entered the Sudharma assembly hall, sits on the Dharma seat and teaches the Dharma.

translated: By that sound, the asuras, frightened, terrified, anxious, flee.

translated: And, Manjushri, there is no one who produces that great Dharma drum, nor does its body exist.

analyzed: adṛśyā mañjuśrīḥ sā mahā dharma dundubhiḥ cakṣuḥ patha samatikrāntā
translated: Manjushri, that great Dharma drum is invisible, unobservable, non-existent, unreal, mindless, non-mental, signless, formless, soundless, non-self, non-dual, beyond the path of the eye.

original: atha ca mañjuśrīs trayastriṃśatkāyikānāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ pūrvaparikarmakṛtānāṃ mahādharmadundubheḥ śabdo niścarati /
analyzed: atha ca mañjuśrīḥ trayastriṃśat kāyikānām deva putrāṇām pūrva parikarma kṛtānām mahā dharmadundubheḥ śabdaḥ niścarati
translated: And yet, Manjushri, the sound of that great Dharma drum emerges for the gods of the Thirty-Three who have previously performed the necessary practices.

analyzed: trāyastriṃśānām deva putrāṇām sarva upadrava upāyāsa upakleśa upaśāntaye saṃvartate
translated: It serves to pacify all the calamities, troubles, and afflictions of the gods of the Thirty-Three.

original: yathā mañjuśrīs tasyā mahādundubher adṛśyo 'nātmabhāvo 'nālokyo 'sann abhūto 'cinto 'cetano 'nimitto
analyzed: yathā mañjuśrīḥ tasyāḥ mahā dundubheḥ adṛśyaḥ na ātma bhāvaḥ na alokyaḥ san abhūtaḥ cintaḥ cetanaḥ nimittaḥ
translated: Just as, Mañjuśrī, that great drum is invisible, without form, unseeable, non-existent, unreal, inconceivable, without mind, without thought, without signs,

analyzed: rūpī arutaḥ bhāvaḥ dvayaḥ cakṣuḥ patha samatikrāntaḥ
translated: without color, without sound, non-dual, and beyond the range of the eyes,

original: pūrvakarmavipākena trayastriṃśatkāyikānāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ sarvopadravopāyāsopakleśopaśāntaye śabdo niścarati /

translated: yet the sound that emerges from it to pacify all the calamities, troubles, and afflictions of the gods of the Thirty-Three arises due to the ripening of their past karma.

analyzed: pramattān ca deva putrān dharma śabdena saṃcodayati
translated: And it stimulates the heedless gods with the sound of the Dharma.

original: sa ca dharmaśabdas trayastriṃśatkāyikānāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ sarvopadravopāyāsopakleśopaśāntaye saṃvartate /
analyzed: sa ca dharmaśabdaḥ trayastriṃśat kāyikānām devaputrāṇām sarva upadrava upāyāsa upakleśa upaśāntaye saṃvartate
translated: That sound of the Dharma serves to pacify all the calamities, troubles, and afflictions of the gods of the Thirty-Three.

original: evam eva mañjuśrīs tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho 'dṛśyo 'nālokyo 'nātmabhāvo 'sann abhūto 'citto 'cetano 'nimitto 'rūpy aruto 'dvayo 'bhāvaś
analyzed: evam eva mañjuśrīḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ dṛśyaḥ na a lokyaḥ na ātma bhāvaḥ san cittaḥ cetanaḥ nimittaḥ bhāvaḥ
translated: In just the same way, Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha is invisible, unseeable, without form, non-existent, unreal, without mind, without thought, without signs,

analyzed: cakṣuḥ patha samatikrāntaḥ
translated: without color, without sound, non-dual, and beyond the range of the eyes.

original: atha ca mañjuśrīḥ sattvāḥ pūrvakarmavipākena yathāśayādhimuktyā dharmaśabdaṃ niścarantaṃ saṃjānanti /

translated: And yet, Mañjuśrī, beings, due to the ripening of their past karma, perceive the sound of the Dharma in accordance with their aspirations and inclinations.

original: sa ca dharmaśabdaḥ sarvasattvānāṃ sarvopadravopāyāsopakleśopaśāntaye saṃvartate /
analyzed: sa ca dharma śabdaḥ sarva sattvānām sarva upadrava upāyāsa upakleśa upaśāntaye saṃvartate
translated: And that sound of the Dharma serves to pacify all the calamities, troubles, afflictions, and illnesses of all beings.

analyzed: dharma svara nirghoṣeṇa tathāgata ghoṣa svaraḥ iti loke saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: By the sound of the Dharma, the Tathāgata's voice and sound are reckoned in the world.

analyzed: na asti ca mañjuśrīḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: But, Mañjuśrī, there is no Tathāgata.

original: atha ca dharmasvaraghoṣeṇa tathāgata iti prajñaptir loke saṃbhavati /

translated: And yet, by the sound of the Dharma, the designation of the Tathāgata arises in the world.

translated: It is due to the ripening of beings' past wholesome karma that the sound of the Tathāgata is heard by beings.

analyzed: ayam tathāgatasya ātmabhāvaḥ iti
translated: This is the Tathāgata's body.

original: ādikarmikāṇāṃ ca bodhisattvānāṃ sarvabālapṛthagjanānāṃ ca tathāgatārambaṇakuśalamūlasaṃjananārthaṃ tathāgatavāk śrūyate /

translated: And the speech of the Tathāgata is heard in order to generate the roots of virtue in the Tathāgata for beginners in the Bodhisattva path and all foolish ordinary beings.

original: api tv anutpanno 'niruddho mañjuśrīs tathāgato veditavyaḥ //
analyzed: api tu anutpannaḥ niruddhaḥ mañjuśrīḥ tathāgataḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: Moreover, Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata should be known as unborn and unceasing.

translated: It is just as, Mañjuśrī, at the end of the hot season, when the first month of the rains has arrived, due to the ripening of the previous karma of beings,

analyzed: upari vaihāyasi āntarīkṣe ākāśe tādṛśāḥ vāyavaḥ vānti
translated: in the sky above, in the space of the sky, there blow such winds

translated: that they give rise to water.

analyzed: saṃbhūtam ca mahā pṛthivyām prapatati
translated: And the water that has arisen falls down on the great earth.

analyzed: tena ca sarvī mahā pṛthivī saṃtarpitā bhavati
translated: And by that, the whole great earth is satisfied.

analyzed: yasmin khalu punar mañjuśrīḥ samaye upari antarīkṣāt mahān udaka skandhaḥ na nipatati

analyzed: tasmin samaye sarva jambūdvīpakāḥ sattvāḥ evam cintayanti
translated: at that time all the beings in Jambudvīpa think like this:

translated: 'There is no cloud here.'

original: yadā tu mañjuśrīr upary antarīkṣād mahān vāriskandho mahāpṛthivyāṃ nipatati /

translated: But, Mañjuśrī, there is no cloud or designation of a cloud here.

translated: That mass of water, Mañjuśrī, disappears right there in the sky,

translated: due to the ripening of beings' past karma.

translated: due to the ripening of beings' past karma.

translated: Mañjuśrī, a cloud is unborn and unceasing, not accessible to the mind, free from coming and going.

analyzed: ca anyeṣām ca sattvānām śrāvaka pratyekabuddha jñāna abhiprāyāṇām avaropita kuśala mūlānām
translated: and for beings who have planted roots of virtue,

analyzed: sa yat bhāṣate tat sarvam tathā avitatha ananyathā
translated: Whatever he speaks, all that is so, not otherwise.

analyzed: tasya deva manuṣyeṣu tathāgataḥ iti nāma kṛtam
translated: Therefore, among gods and humans, he is called the Tathāgata.

analyzed: atha ca mañjuśrīḥ śabdaḥ niścarati deva manuṣyeṣu yat uta tathāgate iti
translated: And yet, Mañjuśrī, the sound that occurs among gods and humans, namely 'the Tathāgata,'

analyzed: na punar mañjuśrīḥ tathāgataḥ saṃvidyate

translated: not arisen, not unborn, not ceased.

analyzed: teṣām evam bhavati
translated: They think like this:

analyzed: parinirvṛtaḥ tathāgataḥ iti
translated: The Tathāgata has passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: na mañjuśrīs tathāgata utpadyate vā nirudhyate vā /🔽anutpanno 'niruddho mañjuśrīs tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: na mañjuśrīḥ tathāgataḥ utpadyate vā nirudhyate vā  anutpannaḥ niruddhaḥ mañjuśrīḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata does not arise or cease.🔽Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata is unborn and unceasing.

analyzed: ādi parinirvṛtaḥ mañjuśrīḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, is originally in parinirvāṇa.

analyzed: yathā mañjuśrīḥ
translated: Just as, Mañjuśrī,

analyzed: udaka ārambaṇena abhūtasya meghasya anutpanna aniruddhasya asataḥ megha prajñaptiḥ sthitā loke meghaḥ iti
translated: due to a water-object, there is the designation of a cloud in the world, of a non-existent, unborn, unceasing cloud that does not exist.

analyzed: evam eva mañjuśrīḥ dharma deśanā ārambaṇena abhūtasya tathāgatasya anutpanna aniruddhasya asataḥ āditas eva ajātasya nāma prajñaptiḥ sthitā loke
translated: In the same way, Mañjuśrī, the name of the non-existent, unborn, unceasing, non-existent Tathāgata, who has never been born from the beginning, is established in the world as 'Tathāgata,

translated: Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One,' through the reference point of teaching the Dharma.

original: tadyathāpi mañjuśrīr mahābrahmānabhibhūr daśatrisāhasramahāsāhasravaśavartī divase divase sarvadevanikāyān vyavalokayati /

translated: Mañjuśrī, it is just as the great Brahmā, the overlord of the trichiliocosm, looks down on all the celestial realms every day,

analyzed: yāvat cāturmahārājika devanikāya paryantān
translated: up to the realm of the Four Great Kings.

original: tena khalu punar mañjuśrīḥ samayena tasya mahābrahmaṇo daśatrisāhasramahāsāhasravaśavartinaḥ sarvadevanikāyān vyavalokayataḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu punar mañjuśrīḥ samayena tasya mahābrahmaṇaḥ daśa tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra vaśavartinaḥ sarva deva nikāyān vyavalokayataḥ
translated: At that time, Mañjuśrī, when the great Brahmā, the overlord of the trichiliocosm, looks down on all the celestial realms,

original: sarvadevanikāyeṣu sarvadevaputrāḥ svakasvakān kāmakrīḍāratiparibhogāṃs tyaktvā sarvatūryatāḍāvacarasaṃgītiṃ śamayitvā /
analyzed: sarva deva nikāyeṣu sarva deva putrāḥ svaka svakān kāma krīḍā rati paribhogān tyaktvā sarva tūrya tāḍāva cara saṃgītim śamayitvā
translated: in all the celestial realms, all the celestial beings abandon their own sensual enjoyments, amusements, pleasures, and experiences, and stop all the music and singing,

original: kāmakrīḍāratimanasikārotsṛṣṭāḥ sagauravā añjaliṃ pragṛhya mahābrahmāṇam animiṣaṃ vyavalokayanti /
analyzed: kāma krīḍā rati manasikāra utsṛṣṭāḥ sa gauravāḥ añjalim pragṛhya mahābrahmāṇam animiṣam vyavalokayanti
translated: and, having given up thoughts of sensual enjoyments, amusements, and pleasures, they respectfully raise their joined palms and look at the great Brahmā with unblinking eyes.

original: sa ca mahābrahmā sarvadevanikāyeṣu muhūrtaṃ darśanaṃ dadāti /
analyzed: sa ca mahābrahmā sarva deva nikāyeṣu muhūrtam darśanam dadāti
translated: And that Great Brahmā appears for a moment in all the divine realms.

original: te ca devaputrās tasmin samaye mahābrahmalokopapattim ākāṅkṣanti /
analyzed: te ca deva putrāḥ tasmin samaye mahābrahma loka upapattim ākāṅkṣanti
translated: And at that time, those gods desire rebirth in the world of Great Brahmā.

analyzed: mahābrahma loka upapattaye ca kuśala mūlāni pariṇāmayanti
translated: And they dedicate their roots of goodness to rebirth in the world of Great Brahmā.

original: sa ca mañjuśrīr mahābrahmācyavamānas tato brahmavimānād anyam adhitiṣṭhati mahābrahmāṇaṃ🔽daśatrisāhasramahāsāhasravaśavartinaṃ pūrvapraṇidhānādhiṣṭhānena teṣāṃ ca devaputrāṇāṃ
analyzed: sa ca mañjuśrīḥ mahābrahmā acyavamānaḥ tatas brahmavimānāt anyam adhitiṣṭhati mahābrahmāṇam  daśa tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra vaśa vartinam pūrva praṇidhāna adhiṣṭhānena teṣām ca devaputrāṇām
translated: And that Great Brahmā, Mañjuśrī, as he is passing away, establishes another Great Brahmā in his place,

analyzed: pūrva kuśala mūla upacayena
translated: who has power over the ten trichiliocosms, by the power of his previous vows and by the accumulation of previous roots of goodness of those gods.

original: sa ca mañjuśrīr nirmito mahābrahmā divase divase sarvadevanikāyān vyavalokayati /
analyzed: sa ca mañjuśrīḥ nirmitaḥ mahā brahmā divase divase sarva devanikāyān vyavalokayati
translated: And that Great Brahmā, Mañjuśrī, the emanation, looks down on all the divine realms every day,

analyzed: yāvat cāturmahārājakāyika devanikāyān
translated: up to the realms of the gods of the Four Great Kings.

original: tena khalu punar mañjuśrīḥ samayena sarveṣu devanikāyeṣu sarvadevaputrāḥ svakasvakān kāmakrīḍāratiparibhogāṃs tyaktvā sarvatūryatāḍāvacarasaṃgītiṃ
analyzed: tena khalu punar mañjuśrīḥ samayena sarveṣu devanikāyeṣu sarva deva putrāḥ svaka svakān kāma krīḍā rati paribhogān tyaktvā sarva tūrya tāḍāva cara saṃgītim
translated: And at that time, Mañjuśrī, all the gods in all the divine realms, having abandoned their own sensual pleasures, amusements, enjoyments, and delights, and all their music and song,

original: kāmakrīḍāratimanasikārotsṛṣṭāḥ sagauravā añjaliṃ pragṛhya mahābrahmāṇam animiṣaṃ vyavalokayanti sma /
analyzed: kāma krīḍā rati manasikāra utsṛṣṭāḥ sa gauravāḥ añjalim pragṛhya mahābrahmāṇam animiṣam vyavalokayanti sma
translated: They let go of their thoughts of desire, play, and pleasure, and with respect they put their palms together and gazed unblinking at Great Brahmā.

original: sa ca mahābrahmā sarvadevanikāyeṣu muhūrtaṃ darśanaṃ dadāti /
analyzed: sa ca mahābrahmā sarva deva nikāyeṣu muhūrtam darśanam dadāti
translated: And that Great Brahmā appeared for a moment in all the divine realms.

analyzed: na ca sthānāt calati
translated: But he did not move from his place.

original: te ca devaputrās tasmin samaye mahābrahmalokopapattim ākāṅkṣanti /
analyzed: te ca deva putrāḥ tasmin samaye mahābrahma loka upapattim ākāṅkṣanti
translated: And at that time, those gods desired rebirth in the realm of Great Brahmā.

analyzed: brahma loka upapattaye ca kuśala mūlāni pariṇāmayanti
translated: And they dedicated their roots of goodness to rebirth in the realm of Great Brahmā.

analyzed: na ca atra mañjuśrīḥ brahmā saṃvidyate
translated: But, Mañjuśrī, Brahmā does not exist there.

analyzed: śūnyaḥ yam mañjuśrīḥ brahmā vaśikaḥ bhūtaḥ nakṣaraḥ ghoṣaḥ deśaḥ cintyaḥ nimittaḥ citta manaḥ vijñāna apagataḥ nu tpannaḥ niruddhaḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī, this Brahmā is empty, false, unreal, without syllables, without sound, without place, nonexistent, inconceivable, signless, devoid of mind, mentality, and consciousness, unarisen, and unceasing.

original: atha ca mañjuśrīḥ sarvadevanikāyeṣu darśanābhāso bhavati /
analyzed: atha ca mañjuśrīḥ sarva deva nikāyeṣu darśana ābhāsaḥ bhavati
translated: And yet, Mañjuśrī, he appears in all the divine realms.

original: tasyaiva mahābrahmaṇaḥ pūrvakuśalamūlapraṇidhānādhiṣṭhānena teṣāṃ ca devaputrāṇāṃ pūrvakuśalamūlopacayena /
analyzed: tasya eva mahābrahmaṇaḥ pūrva kuśala mūla praṇidhāna adhiṣṭhānena teṣām ca devaputrāṇām pūrva kuśala mūla upacayena
translated: This is due to the power of the previous roots of goodness and aspirations of that Great Brahmā himself, and to the previous accumulation of roots of goodness by those gods.

original: na ca mañjuśrīs teṣāṃ devaputrāṇām evaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na ca mañjuśrīḥ teṣām deva putrāṇām evam bhavati
translated: But, Mañjuśrī, those gods do not think:🔽This is the power of our own roots of goodness.

analyzed: nirmitaḥ yam brahmā
translated: This Brahmā is created.

analyzed: śūnyaḥ vaśikaḥ bhūtaḥ nakṣaraḥ ghoṣaḥ deśaḥ bhāvaḥ cintyaḥ nimittaḥ citta manaḥ vijñāna apagataḥ nu tpannaḥ niruddhaḥ vā iti
translated: He is empty, insubstantial, unreal, without letters, without sound, without a country, non-existent, inconceivable, signless, devoid of mind, thought, and consciousness, unborn, and unceasing.

original: evam eva mañjuśrīs tathāgato 'py arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ śūnyo vaśiko 'bhūto 'nakṣaro 'ghoṣo 'deśo 'bhāvo 'cintyo 'nimittaś cittamanovijñānāpagato
analyzed: evam eva mañjuśrīḥ tathāgataḥ pi arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ śūnyaḥ vaśikaḥ bhūtaḥ nakṣaraḥ ghoṣaḥ deśaḥ bhāvaḥ cintyaḥ nimittaḥ citta manaḥ vijñāna apagataḥ
translated: In the same way, Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One is empty, insubstantial, unreal, without letters, without sound, without a country, non-existent, inconceivable, signless, devoid of mind, thought, and consciousness,

analyzed: n utpannaḥ niruddhaḥ
translated: unborn, and unceasing.

original: atha ca punar mañjuśrīs tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ pūrvabodhisattvacaryāpraṇidhānādhiṣṭhānena /
analyzed: atha ca punar mañjuśrīḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ pūrva bodhisattva caryā praṇidhāna adhiṣṭhānena
translated: However, Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, by the power of his previous vows in the Bodhisattva practice,

analyzed: ādi karmiṇām ca bodhisattvānām sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yāna saṃprasthitānām ca sarva bāla pṛthagjanānām
translated: and by the power of all the roots of goodness of the beginner bodhisattvas and all those who have set out in the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas, and of all the foolish ordinary beings,

original: sarvakuśalamūlādhiṣṭhānena lakṣaṇaśatasahasrālaṃkṛtas tathāgataḥ pratibimbam iva loke saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: sarva kuśala mūla adhiṣṭhānena lakṣaṇa śata sahasra alaṃkṛtaḥ tathāgataḥ pratibimbam iva loke saṃdṛśyate
translated: the Tathāgata, adorned with a hundred thousand marks, appears in the world like a reflection,

analyzed: na ca sthānāt calati
translated: but he does not move from his place.

original: na ca mañjuśrīr ādikarmikāṇāṃ ca bodhisattvānāṃ sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhayānikānāṃ sarvabālapṛthagjanānāṃ caivaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na ca mañjuśrīḥ ādi karmikāṇām ca bodhisattvānām sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yānikānām sarva bāla pṛthagjanānām ca evam bhavati
translated: And, Mañjuśrī, it does not occur to the beginner bodhisattvas, to those in the Śrāvakayāna and Pratyekabuddhayāna, or to any ordinary foolish people,

analyzed: śūnyaḥ tathāgataḥ vaśikaḥ bhūtaḥ nakṣaraḥ ghoṣaḥ deśaḥ bhāvaḥ cintyaḥ nimittaḥ citta manaḥ vijñāna apagataḥ nu tpannaḥ niruddhaḥ ca iti
translated: that the Tathāgata is empty, insubstantial, unreal, without letters, without sound, without a country, non-existent, inconceivable, signless, devoid of mind, thought, and consciousness, unborn, and unceasing.

original: atha ca mañjuśrīs tathāgatātmabhāvāl lakṣaṇaśatasahasrālaṃkṛtāt sarvatathāgateryāpatheṣu śūnyeṣu nānāvidhivicitrāṇāṃ nānādhimuktānāṃ sattvānāṃ
analyzed: atha ca mañjuśrīḥ tathāgata ātmabhāvāt lakṣaṇa śata sahasra alaṃkṛtāt sarva tathāgata īryāpatheṣu śūnyeṣu nānā vidhi vicitrāṇām nānā adhimuktānām sattvānām
translated: And yet, Mañjuśrī, from the Tathāgata's body, adorned with a hundred thousand marks, in all the Tathāgata's activities, which are empty,

analyzed: mahā dharma deśanā niścarati
translated: the great Dharma teaching issues forth for the various kinds of beings with various inclinations.

original: sā ca dharmadeśanā sarvasattvānāṃ sarvopadravopāyāsopakleśopaśāntaye saṃvartate /
analyzed: sā ca dharma deśanā sarva sattvānām sarva upadrava upāyāsa upakleśa upaśāntaye saṃvartate
translated: And that Dharma teaching is conducive to the pacification of all harm, calamity, affliction, and distress for all beings.

original: tatra ca tathāgataḥ samayaḥ sarvatropekṣako nirvikalpo nirviśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: tatra ca tathāgataḥ samayaḥ sarvatra upekṣakaḥ nirvikalpaḥ nirviśeṣaḥ
translated: And in that regard, the Tathāgata is impartial to all, without discrimination, without distinction.

original: tad anenāpi te mañjuśrīḥ paryāyeṇaivaṃ veditavyam /
analyzed: tat anena api te mañjuśrīḥ paryāyeṇa evam veditavyam
translated: By this method also, Mañjuśrī, this should be known:

analyzed: anutpādaḥ nirodhaḥ iti tathāgatasya etat adhivacanam iti
translated: 'Non-arising and non-ceasing' is a designation for the Tathāgata.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃs tasyāṃ velāyām ime gāthe abhāṣat /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām ime gāthe abhāṣat
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses at that time:

original: anutpādadharmaḥ satataṃ tathāgataḥ sarve ca dharmāḥ sugatena sādṛśāḥ /
analyzed: anutpāda dharmaḥ satatam tathāgataḥ sarve ca dharmāḥ sugatena sādṛśāḥ
translated: The Tathāgata is always of the nature of non-arising, and all dharmas are similar to the Sugata.

original: nimittagrāheṇa tu bālabuddhayo asatsu dharmeṣu caranti loke //
analyzed: nimitta grāheṇa tu bāla buddhayaḥ asatsu dharmeṣu caranti loke
translated: But through the grasping of signs, the minds of fools wander among non-existent dharmas in the world.

original: tathāgato hi pratibimbabhūtaḥ kuśalasya dharmasya anāsravasya /
analyzed: tathāgataḥ hi pratibimba bhūtaḥ kuśalasya dharmasya anāsravasya
translated: The Tathāgata is a reflection of wholesome, undefiled dharmas.

original: na cātra tathatā na tathāgato 'sti bimbaṃ ca saṃdṛśyati sarvaloke //
analyzed: na ca atra tathatā na tathāgataḥ u sti bimbam ca saṃdṛśyati sarva loke
translated: But here there is no suchness, nor is there a Tathāgata. A reflection is seen in the whole world.

original: tadyathā mañjuśrīḥ sūryaraśmayo jambūdvīpe pūrvataram eva tāvad mahāśailendrarājānam avabhāsayanti /
analyzed: tat yathā mañjuśrīḥ sūrya raśmayaḥ jambūdvīpe pūrvataram eva tāvat mahā śaila indra rājānam avabhāsayanti
translated: Just as, Mañjuśrī, the sun's rays first illuminate the great king of mountains, the lord of mountains, in Jambūdvīpa.

analyzed: tatas paścāt cakravāḍān mahā cakravāḍān avabhāsayanti
translated: Then afterwards they illuminate the Cakravāḍas and Mahācakravāḍas.

analyzed: tatas paścāt ucca uccān pṛthivī pradeśān avabhāsayanti
translated: Then afterwards they illuminate the high and lofty regions of the earth.

original: tataḥ paścād iha jambūdvīpe nimnān pṛthivīpradeśān avabhāsayanti /
analyzed: tatas paścāt iha jambūdvīpe nimnān pṛthivī pradeśān avabhāsayanti
translated: Then afterwards they illuminate the low-lying regions of the earth here in Jambūdvīpa.

original: te ca mañjuśrīḥ sūryaraśmayo na kalpayanti /🔽na vikalpayanti /🔽na cintayanti /
analyzed: te ca mañjuśrīḥ sūrya raśmayaḥ na kalpayanti  na vikalpayanti  na cintayanti
translated: And those sun's rays, Mañjuśrī, do not conceptualize,🔽do not discriminate,🔽do not think,

analyzed: na vicintayanti
translated: do not reflect.

analyzed: citta manaḥ vijñāna apagatāḥ mañjuśrīḥ sūrya raśmayaḥ
translated: The sun's rays, Mañjuśrī, are devoid of mind, mentality, and consciousness.

analyzed: an utpannāḥ a niruddhāḥ
translated: They are unborn and unceasing.

analyzed: alakṣaṇāḥ lakṣaṇa apagatāḥ
translated: They are without characteristics, devoid of characteristics.

analyzed: amanaskārāḥ manaskāra apagatāḥ  aprapañcāḥ prapañca apagatāḥ
translated: They are without mental activity, devoid of mental activity.🔽They are non-elaborate, devoid of elaboration.

analyzed: a paridāhāḥ niṣparidāhāḥ  naurasthāḥ na parasthāḥ
translated: They are without burning, free from burning.🔽They are not here, not there.

analyzed: na uccāḥ na nīcāḥ
translated: They are not high, not low.

analyzed: na baddhāḥ na muktāḥ
translated: They are not bound, not liberated.

analyzed: na jñānavantaḥ na ajñānavantaḥ
translated: They are not endowed with knowledge, not devoid of knowledge.

analyzed: na saṃkleśāḥ na niḥkleśāḥ
translated: They are not defiled, not undefiled.

original: na satyavādino na mṛṣāvādinaḥ /🔽na tīre na nimne /
analyzed: na satya vādinaḥ na mṛṣāvādinaḥ  na tīre na nimne
translated: They are not speakers of truth, not speakers of falsehood.🔽They are not on the bank, not in the lowlands.

analyzed: na sthale na oghe
translated: They are not on dry land, not in the flood.

analyzed: na tarka avacarāḥ na a tarka avacarāḥ
translated: They are not the domain of reasoning, not beyond the domain of reasoning.

original: atha ca punar mañjuśrīḥ pṛthivyām uccanīcamadhyaviśeṣeṇa hīnamadhyotkṛṣṭāvabhāsasya cchāyā vaicitryaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: atha ca punar mañjuśrīḥ pṛthivyām ucca nīca madhya viśeṣeṇa hīna madhya utkṛṣṭa avabhāsasya chāyā vaicitryam bhavati
translated: And yet, Mañjuśrī, on the earth there is a diversity of shadows due to the high, low, and middle distinctions, and the inferior, middling, and excellent appearances.

original: evam eva mañjuśrīs tathāgato 'py arhan samyaksaṃbuddho na kalpayati /🔽na vikalpayati /
analyzed: evam eva mañjuśrīḥ tathāgataḥ pi arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ na kalpayati  na vikalpayati
translated: In the same way, Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One does not imagine,🔽does not discriminate,

analyzed: na cintayati
translated: does not think,

analyzed: na vicintayati
translated: does not reflect.

analyzed: citta manaḥ vijñāna apagataḥ mañjuśrīḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: The Tathāgata, Mañjuśrī, is devoid of mind, mentality, and consciousness.

analyzed: anutpannaḥ niruddhaḥ
translated: He is unborn and unceasing.

analyzed: alakṣaṇaḥ lakṣaṇa apagataḥ
translated: It is without characteristics, free from characteristics.

analyzed: amanaskāraḥ manaskāra apagataḥ  aprapañcaḥ prapañca apagataḥ
translated: It is without mental activity, free from mental activity.🔽It is non-elaborate, free from elaboration.

analyzed: a paridāhaḥ niṣparidāhaḥ  naurasthaḥ na pārasthaḥ
translated: It is without burning, free from burning.🔽It is not on this shore, not on the other shore.

analyzed: na uccaḥ na nīcaḥ
translated: It is not high, not low.

analyzed: na baddhaḥ na muktaḥ
translated: It is not bound, not liberated.

analyzed: na jñānavān na ajñānavān
translated: It is not knowing, not not-knowing.

analyzed: na saṃkleśaḥ na niḥkleśaḥ
translated: It is not defiled, not undefiled.

original: na satyavādī na mṛṣāvādī /🔽na nimne nānimne /🔽na sthale nāsthale /
analyzed: na satya vādī na mṛṣāvādī  na nimne na a nimne  na sthale na a sthale
translated: It is not speaking the truth, not speaking falsely.🔽It is not low, not not-low.🔽It is not on dry land, not not on dry land.

analyzed: na oghe na anoghe
translated: It is not in a flood, not not in a flood.

analyzed: na sarvajñaḥ na asarvajñaḥ
translated: It is not omniscient, not not omniscient.

analyzed: na tarkaḥ na a tarkaḥ na pracāraḥ
translated: It is not discursive thought, not not discursive thought. It is not activity,

analyzed: na a pracāraḥ
translated: not non-activity.

analyzed: na samudācāraḥ na asamudācāraḥ  na smṛtimān na a smṛtimān
translated: It is not engagement, not non-engagement.🔽It is not mindful, not not mindful.

analyzed: na cetanaḥ na niścetanaḥ
translated: It is not conscious, not unconscious.

analyzed: na manaḥ na amanaḥ
translated: It is not mind, not not mind.

analyzed: na nirjātaḥ na a nirjātaḥ
translated: It is not born, not unborn.

analyzed: na prajñapyaḥ na a prajñapyaḥ  na netrī na a netrī
translated: It is not to be designated, not not to be designated.🔽It is not a guide, not not a guide.

analyzed: na mārga praṇetā na a mārga praṇetā
translated: It is not a path-maker, not not a path-maker.

analyzed: na prāpta phalaḥ na a prāpta phalaḥ  na kalpaḥ na akalpaḥ
translated: It is not one who has attained the fruits, not one who has not attained the fruits.🔽It is not a kalpa, not not a kalpa.

analyzed: na kalpa apagataḥ na akalpa apagataḥ
translated: It is not free from kalpas, not not free from kalpas.

original: atha ca punar mañjuśrīs tathāgatasūryamaṇḍalajñānaraśmayas traidhātuke 'nantamadhyadharmadhātvapratihataraśmyavabhāsapramuktāḥ /
analyzed: atha ca punar mañjuśrīḥ tathāgata sūrya maṇḍala jñāna raśmayaḥ traidhātuke nanta madhya dharmadhātu a pratihata raśmi avabhāsa pramuktāḥ
translated: Moreover, Mañjuśrī, the rays of knowledge of the sun-disk of the Tathāgata are emitted in the three realms, illuminating the infinite and boundless dharma-element without obstruction.

original: prasṛtāś ca raśmayaḥ pūrvataram eva mahāśailendrakalpādhyāśayānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ kāye nipatanti /
analyzed: prasṛtāḥ ca raśmayaḥ pūrvataram eva mahā śailendra kalpa adhyāśayānām bodhisattvānām kāye nipatanti
translated: And those rays first fall on the bodies of bodhisattvas whose superior intention is like the great king of mountains.

analyzed: tatas paścāt pratyekabuddha yāna saṃprasthitānām kāye nipatanti
translated: After that, they fall on the bodies of those who have set out in the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: tatas paścāt śrāvaka yāna saṃprasthitānām kāye nipatanti
translated: After that, they fall on the bodies of those who have set out in the vehicle of the śrāvakas.

original: tataḥ paścāt kuśalādhyāśayānāṃ yathādhimuktīnāṃ sattvānāṃ kāye nipatanti /

analyzed: anupalabdhi tvāt sarva dharmāṇām

original: yā samatā sā sthitā /🔽yā sthitā sācalanatā /

translated: That which is equality is abiding.🔽That which is abiding is unshakability.

analyzed: yā a calana tā sā a niśraya tā
translated: That which is unshakability is non-reliance.

analyzed: a niśritasya sarva dharmeṣu na asti citta pratiṣṭhānam
translated: One who is not reliant on any phenomena does not have a mind that is established.

analyzed: apratiṣṭhita cittasya anutpattiḥ ājāyate
translated: For one whose mind is not established, non-arising occurs.

translated: For one who sees in this way, the mind and mental factors do not proceed in a distorted manner.🔽One whose mind is undistorted attains the state of being as it is.

analyzed: yathāvat prāptaḥ na prapañcayati  a prapañcayataḥ pracāraḥ na asti
translated: One who has attained the state of being as it is does not proliferate.🔽For one who does not proliferate, there is no activity.

original: yadā na pracarati tadā na saṃcarati /
analyzed: yadā na pracarati tadā na saṃcarati
translated: When there is no activity, then there is no engagement.

original: yadā na saṃcarati tadā na visarati /
analyzed: yadā na saṃcarati tadā na visarati
translated: When there is no engagement, then there is no dispersion.

original: avisaraṃ dharmatāṃ na virodhayati /🔽dharmatām avirodhayan sarvatrānulomo bhavati /
analyzed: a visaram dharmatām na virodhayati  dharmatām a virodhayan sarvatra anulomaḥ bhavati
translated: One who does not disperse does not contradict the nature of phenomena.🔽One who does not contradict the nature of phenomena is in accord with everything.

analyzed: sarvatra anulomaḥ dharma prakṛteḥ na calati
translated: One who is in accord with everything does not waver from the nature of phenomena.

analyzed: dharmaprakṛteḥ acalam dharmaprakṛti prāptaḥ bhavati
translated: He is unshakable from the nature of dharmas, and has attained the nature of dharmas.

analyzed: dharma prakṛti prāptaḥ na kiṃcid prapañcayati
translated: Having attained the nature of dharmas, he does not elaborate on anything.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ

analyzed: yaḥ ca atyanta ajātaḥ
translated: And what is utterly unborn

analyzed: yaḥ ca niyāma prāptaḥ sa sarva dharma manasikāraiḥ sārdham na saṃvasati
translated: And what has attained certainty does not dwell together with any mental engagements with dharmas.

original: yadā sarvadharmamanasikāraiḥ sārdhaṃ na saṃvasati tadā saṃvāśyo na bhavati /
analyzed: yadā sarva dharma manasikāraiḥ sārdham na saṃvasati tadā saṃvāśyaḥ na bhavati
translated: When he does not dwell together with any mental engagements with dharmas, then he is not to be associated with.

original: yadā saṃvāśyo na bhavati tadā na bhavati na vibhavati /
analyzed: yadā saṃvāśyaḥ na bhavati tadā na bhavati na vibhavati
translated: When he is not to be associated with, then he does not exist and does not not exist.

original: yadā na bhavati na vibhavati tadā sthito dharmaprāpto bhavati /
analyzed: yadā na bhavati na vibhavati tadā sthitaḥ dharma prāptaḥ bhavati
translated: When he does not exist and does not not exist, then he is established and has attained the dharmas.

original: yadā sthito dharmaprāpto bhavati tadā yoniśodharmaprayukto bhavati /
analyzed: yadā sthitaḥ dharma prāptaḥ bhavati tadā yoniśas dharma prayuktaḥ bhavati
translated: When he is established and has attained the dharmas, then he is engaged in the proper way with the dharmas.

original: yoniśodharmaprayuktasya na kaścid dharmo 'sti yo na buddhadharmaḥ /
analyzed: yoniśas dharma prayuktasya na kaścid yaḥ na buddha dharmaḥ
translated: For one engaged in the proper way with the dharmas, there is no dharma that is not a buddha-dharma.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  śūnyatā anubodha tvāt
translated: Why is that?🔽Because of the realization of emptiness.

analyzed: yaḥ ca śūnyatā anubodhaḥ sa bodhiḥ
translated: And the realization of emptiness is awakening.

analyzed: saḥ evam śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita an abhisaṃskāra aniketa asaṃbhava a grāhya an ālaya avabodhāt bodhiḥ
translated: Thus, enlightenment is due to the realization of emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-production, non-existence, non-basis, non-grasping, and non-abiding.

analyzed: bodhiḥ ca yoniśas uprayogaḥ
translated: And enlightenment is proper application.

analyzed: yoniśas prayogaḥ  yoniśas prayogena āmā ucyate  anupekṣā prakṣepaḥ
translated: Proper application.🔽One is liberated through proper application.🔽Non-abandonment and non-projection.

analyzed: akāra vikāra prayogaḥ
translated: Application without change.

analyzed: asaṃbaddhaḥ  a pramukta prayogaḥ
translated: Unconnected.🔽Application without release.

analyzed: aneka tva a nānā tva prayogaḥ
translated: Application without multiplicity or variety.

analyzed: anāgata prayogaḥ yoniśas prayogaḥ
translated: Future application is proper application.

original: na tatra prayogo na pramāṇaṃ na phalasākṣātkriyā /
analyzed: na tatra prayogaḥ na pramāṇam na phala sākṣātkriyā
translated: There is no application, no valid cognition, and no direct realization of results.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: prakṛtiprabhāsvaraṃ cittaṃ tac cāgantukair upakleśair upakliśyate na ca prakṛtiḥ saṃkliśyate /
analyzed: prakṛti prabhāsvaram cittam tat ca āgantukaiḥ upakleśaiḥ upakliśyate na ca prakṛtiḥ saṃkliśyate
translated: The mind is naturally luminous, and it is defiled by adventitious afflictions, but its nature is not defiled.

analyzed: yā ca prakṛti prabhāsvara tā sā asaṃkleśa tā
translated: And that natural luminosity is non-defilement.

original: yā cāsaṃkleśatā tatra pratipakṣo nāsti yena pratipakṣeṇa kleśaprahāṇaṃ syāt /
analyzed: yā ca asaṃkleśa tā tatra pratipakṣaḥ na asti yena pratipakṣeṇa kleśa prahāṇam syāt
translated: And where there is non-defilement, there is no antidote by which afflictions could be abandoned.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽na śuddhaḥ śudhyati śuddha eva saḥ /🔽yaś ca śuddhaḥ so 'nutpādaḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  na śuddhaḥ śudhyati śuddhaḥ eva saḥ  yaḥ ca śuddhaḥ saḥ n utpādaḥ
translated: Why is that?🔽The pure is not purified, it is pure just as it is.🔽And what is pure is non-arising.

analyzed: yaḥ ca anutpādaḥ saḥ ninditaḥ
translated: And what is non-arising is blameless.

original: yaś cāninditaḥ sa nandīprahāṇaṃ tatra sarvasnehā nirudhyante /
analyzed: yaḥ ca aninditaḥ sa nandī prahāṇam tatra sarva snehāḥ nirudhyante
translated: And what is not censured is the abandonment of joy. There, all attachments cease.

analyzed: yatra sarva snehāḥ nirudhyante saḥ nutpādaḥ
translated: Where all attachments cease, that is non-arising.

analyzed: yaḥ ca anutpādaḥ sa bodhiḥ
translated: And what is non-arising is enlightenment.

analyzed: yā bodhiḥ sā samatā
translated: What is enlightenment is equality.

analyzed: yā samatā sā tathatā
translated: What is equality is suchness.

original: tathatāpratiṣṭhitāś ca sarvadharmāḥ saṃskṛtā asaṃskṛtāś ca /
analyzed: tathatā pratiṣṭhitāḥ ca sarva dharmāḥ saṃskṛtāḥ asaṃskṛtāḥ ca
translated: And all dharmas, whether conditioned or unconditioned, are established in suchness.

original: yā ca tathatā na tatra saṃskṛtaṃ nāsaṃskṛtaṃ na dvayaprajñaptiḥ /
analyzed: yā ca tathatā na tatra saṃskṛtam na asaṃskṛtam na dvaya prajñaptiḥ
translated: And in that suchness, there is neither the conditioned nor the unconditioned, nor the designation of duality.

original: yatra na saṃskṛtaṃ nāsaṃskṛtaṃ na dvayaprajñaptiḥ sā tathatā /
analyzed: yatra na saṃskṛtam na asaṃskṛtam na dvaya prajñaptiḥ sā tathatā
translated: Where there is neither the conditioned nor the unconditioned, nor the designation of duality, that is suchness.

original: yā tathatā sānanyatathatā /🔽yānanyatathatā sāvikāratathatā /🔽yā cāvikāratathatā sānāgatatathatā /
analyzed: yā tathatā sā ananyatathatā  yā ananya tathatā sā avikāra tathatā  yā ca avikāra tathatā sā anāgata tathatā
translated: And that suchness is the suchness of non-difference.🔽What is the suchness of non-difference is the suchness of immutability.🔽And what is the suchness of immutability is the suchness of the future.

analyzed: yā ca anāgata tathatā sā avitathatā
translated: And what is the suchness of the future is the suchness of the present.

analyzed: yā ca avitatha tā sā yathāvat tathatā
translated: And what is the suchness of the present is the suchness of reality.

original: yā yathāvattathatā sā najātutathatā /🔽yā najātutathatā sā na saṃkliśyate na viśudhyate /
analyzed: yā yathāvat tathatā sā na jātu tathatā  yā najātutathatā sā na saṃkliśyate na viśudhyate
translated: What is the suchness of reality is the suchness of non-birth.🔽What is the suchness of non-birth is neither defiled nor purified.

original: yā na saṃkliśyate na viśudhyate sā notpadyate na nirudhyate /
analyzed: yā na saṃkliśyate na viśudhyate sā na utpadyate na nirudhyate
translated: What is neither defiled nor purified does not arise or cease.

original: yā notpadyate na nirudhyate sā nirvāṇena samā /🔽yā nirvāṇena samā sā na saṃsarati na parinirvāti /
analyzed: yā na utpadyate na nirudhyate sā nirvāṇena samā  yā nirvāṇena samā sā na saṃsarati na parinirvāti
translated: What is not produced and does not cease is the same as nirvāṇa.🔽What is the same as nirvāṇa does not transmigrate and does not attain final nirvāṇa.

original: yā na saṃsarati na parinirvāti sā nātītā nānāgatā na pratyutpannā /
analyzed: yā na saṃsarati na parinirvāti sā na atītā na anāgatā na pratyutpannā
translated: What does not transmigrate and does not attain final nirvāṇa is not past, not future, and not present.

original: yā nātītā nānāgatā na pratyutpannā sā na hīnā na madhyā notkṛṣṭā /
analyzed: yā na atītā na anāgatā na pratyutpannā sā na hīnā na madhyā na utkṛṣṭā
translated: What is not past, not future, and not present is not inferior, not middling, and not superior.

original: yā na hīnā na madhyā notkṛṣṭā sā tathatā //
analyzed: yā na hīnā na madhyā na utkṛṣṭā sā tathatā
translated: What is not inferior, not middling, and not superior is thusness.

analyzed: tathatā nāma ucyate  tattva artha adhivacanam etat tattvam ucyate
translated: Thusness is said to be

analyzed: tathātvam tathatvam ucyate
translated: a designation for the meaning of reality. That reality is said to be

original: tathaiva tathatā cātmā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: tathā eva tathatā ca ātmā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram
translated: suchness. That suchness and the self are non-dual, this is not divided into two.

original: sa cittamanovijñānāpratiṣṭhito na kalpayati na vikalpayati /
analyzed: sa citta manaḥ vijñāna a pratiṣṭhitaḥ na kalpayati na vikalpayati
translated: He, not established in mind, thought, or consciousness, does not imagine, does not conceptualize.

original: anavakalpayann avikalpayan nātītaṃ karoty anāgataṃ na manyate pratyutpannaṃ na prapañcayati //
analyzed: an avakalpayan a vikalpayan na atītam karoti anāgatam na manyate pratyutpannam na prapañcayati
translated: Not imagining, not conceptualizing, he does not make the past, does not conceive the future, does not proliferate about the present.

analyzed: bodhiḥ mañjuśrīḥ aśarīrā asaṃskṛtā
translated: Awakening, Mañjuśrī, is bodiless and unconditioned.

analyzed: tatra aśarīra tā mañjuśrīḥ yā na cakṣuḥ vijñāna vijñeyā
translated: Here, Mañjuśrī, the bodilessness is that which is not to be known by eye-consciousness,

analyzed: na śrotra  na ghrāṇa
translated: not by ear,🔽not by nose,🔽not by tongue,

analyzed: na jihvā
translated: not by body,

analyzed: na manaḥ vijñāna vijñeyā
translated: not to be known by mind-consciousness.

original: yan mañjuśrīr na cittamanovijñānavijñeyaṃ tad asaṃskṛtam /
analyzed: yat mañjuśrīḥ na citta manaḥ vijñāna vijñeyam tat asaṃskṛtam
translated: Mañjuśrī, that which is not to be known by mind, thought, or consciousness is unconditioned.

original: asaṃskṛtam ucyate yatra notpādo na sthitir na vyayaḥ /
analyzed: asaṃskṛtam ucyate yatra na utpādaḥ na sthitiḥ na vyayaḥ
translated: The unconditioned is said to be that in which there is no arising, no abiding, no passing away.

analyzed: tat ucyate tri maṇḍala pariśuddham a saṃskṛtam
translated: That is said to be the unconditioned purity of the three spheres.

analyzed: yathā eva a saṃskṛtaḥ tathā evam saṃskṛtam boddhavyam
translated: The conditioned should be understood in the same way as the unconditioned.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: sarva dharmāṇām yaḥ svabhāvaḥ saḥ svabhāvaḥ
translated: The nature of all dharmas is their non-nature.

analyzed: tatra na asti dvayam iti
translated: Therein, there is no duality.

analyzed: bodhiḥ mañjuśrīḥ abheda padam etat  tatra katamaḥ bhedaḥ
translated: Awakening, Mañjuśrī, is the state of non-differentiation.

analyzed: katamat padam
translated: What is non-differentiation? What is the state?

analyzed: a saṃjñā bhedaḥ tathatā padam
translated: The non-differentiation of non-perception is the state of suchness.

original: apratiṣṭhānam abhedo dharmadhātuḥ padam /🔽anānātvam abhedo bhūtakoṭiḥ padam /
analyzed: apratiṣṭhānam abhedaḥ dharmadhātuḥ padam
translated: Non-abiding is the non-differentiation, the state of the dharma-realm.🔽Non-plurality is the non-differentiation, the state of the peak of existence.

analyzed: calana tā padam
translated: Non-apprehension is the non-differentiation, the state of non-wavering.

analyzed: a vitarkaḥ praṇihitam padam
translated: The non-differentiation of emptiness is the state of signlessness.🔽Non-discursiveness is the non-differentiation, the state of wishlessness.
Non-aspiration is the non-differentiation, the state of non-sentience.

analyzed: sattva asvabhāvaḥ bhedaḥ ākāśam padam  anupalambhaḥ bhedaḥ n utpādam padam
translated: The nature of sentient beings is the non-differentiation, the state of space.🔽Non-apprehension is the non-differentiation, the state of non-arising.

analyzed: anirodhaḥ saṃskṛtam padam
translated: Non-cessation is the non-differentiation, the state of the unconditioned.

analyzed: a pracāraḥ bhedaḥ bodhiḥ padam
translated: Non-activity is the non-differentiation, the state of awakening.

analyzed: vyupaśamaḥ bhedaḥ nirvāṇam padam
translated: Quiescence is the non-differentiation, the state of nirvāṇa.

analyzed: an abhinirvṛttiḥ abhedaḥ jātiḥ padam
translated: Non-arising, non-differentiation, and non-production are the state.

original: bodhir mañjuśrīr na kāyenābhisambudhyate na cittena /
analyzed: bodhiḥ mañjuśrīḥ na kāyena abhisambudhyate na cittena
translated: Mañjuśrī, enlightenment is not realized by the body or by the mind.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: jaḍaḥ kāyaḥ mañjuśrīḥ niśceṣṭo cetanaḥ tṛṇa kāṣṭha kuḍya loṣṭa pratibhāsa upamaḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī, the body is dull, inert, lifeless, like a grass, wood, wall, or clod of earth.

original: cittaṃ ca māyopamaṃ riktaṃ tuccham abhūtam asaṃskṛtam /
analyzed: cittam ca māyā upamam riktam tuccham a bhūtam a saṃskṛtam
translated: And the mind is like an illusion, empty, void, unreal, unconditioned.

original: yo mañjuśrīr evaṃ kāyasya cittasya cāvabodhaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ mañjuśrīḥ evam kāyasya cittasya ca avabodhaḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī, this understanding of the body and mind

analyzed: ayam ucyate mañjuśrīḥ bodhiḥ
translated: is called enlightenment, Mañjuśrī.

analyzed: vyavahāram upādāya na punar paramārthataḥ
translated: But only conventionally, not ultimately.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: na mañjuśrīr bodhiḥ kāyena vā cittena vā dharmeṇa vā adharmeṇa vā bhūtena vābhūtena vā satyena vā mṛṣā vā vacanīyā //
analyzed: na mañjuśrīḥ bodhiḥ kāyena vā cittena vā dharmeṇa vā adharmeṇa vā bhūtena vā abhūtena vā satyena vā mṛṣā vā vacanīyā
translated: Mañjuśrī, enlightenment cannot be expressed by the body, mind, Dharma, non-Dharma, truth, or falsehood.

analyzed: avacanīyā mañjuśrīḥ bodhiḥ sarva dharmaiḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī, enlightenment cannot be expressed by any Dharma.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: na mañjuśrīr bodhiḥ kiñcit sthānaṃ yena ca vyavahāraṃ gacchet /
analyzed: na mañjuśrīḥ bodhiḥ kiñcid sthānam yena ca vyavahāram gacchet
translated: Mañjuśrī, enlightenment has no basis by which it could be conventionally designated.

original: yathā mañjuśrīr ākāśasthānam asaṃskṛtam anutpannam aniruddham avacanīyaṃ tathā mañjuśrīr bodhir asaṃskṛtāsthānānutpannāniruddhāvacanīyā /
analyzed: yathā mañjuśrīḥ ākāśa sthānam a saṃskṛtam an utpannam a niruddham a vacanīyam tathā mañjuśrīḥ bodhiḥ a saṃskṛtā a sthāna an utpanna a niruddhā a vacanīyā
translated: Just as space is unconditioned, unborn, unceasing, and inexpressible, Mañjuśrī, in the same way awakening is unconditioned, unborn, unceasing, and inexpressible.

original: yathā mañjuśrīr bhūtaṃ parigaveṣyamāṇaṃ sarvadharmair avacanīyam /
analyzed: yathā mañjuśrīḥ bhūtam parigaveṣyamāṇam sarva dharmaiḥ a vacanīyam
translated: Just as, Mañjuśrī, the real, when sought, is inexpressible by all dharmas,

original: evam eva mañjuśrīr bodhir bhūtā parigaveṣyamāṇā sarvadharmair avacanīyā /
analyzed: evam eva mañjuśrīḥ bodhiḥ bhūtā parigaveṣyamāṇā sarva dharmaiḥ a vacanīyā
translated: in the same way, Mañjuśrī, awakening, the real, when sought, is inexpressible by all dharmas.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: na mañjuśrīḥ bhūte vacanam saṃvidyate n utpanna a niruddha tvāt
translated: Because, Mañjuśrī, in the real, speech does not exist, because it is unborn and unceasing.

analyzed: bodhiḥ mañjuśrīḥ a grāhya tā an ālaya tā
translated: Awakening, Mañjuśrī, is ungraspable and baseless.

analyzed: tatra mañjuśrīḥ katamā a grāhya tā katamā an ālaya tā
translated: There, Mañjuśrī, what is ungraspable and what is baseless?

original: cakṣuḥparijñā mañjuśrīr agrāhyatā rūpānupalabdhir anālayatā /🔽śrotraparijñāgrāhyatā śabdānupalabdhir anālayatā /🔽ghrāṇaparijñāgrāhyatā gandhānupalabdhir anālayatā /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ parijñā mañjuśrīḥ a grāhya tā rūpa anupalabdhiḥ an ālaya tā  śrotra parijñā grāhya tā śabda anupalabdhiḥ an ālaya tā  ghrāṇa parijñā grāhya tā gandha anupalabdhiḥ an ālaya tā
translated: The thorough cognition of the eye, Mañjuśrī, is ungraspable; the non-apprehension of form is baseless.🔽The thorough cognition of the ear is ungraspable; the non-apprehension of sound is baseless.🔽The thorough cognition of the nose is ungraspable; the non-apprehension of smell is baseless.

analyzed: jihvā parijñā grāhya tā rasa anupalabdhiḥ an ālaya tā
translated: The thorough cognition of the tongue is ungraspable; the non-apprehension of taste is baseless.

analyzed: kāya parijñā grāhya tā spraṣṭavya anupalabdhiḥ an ālaya tā
translated: The non-apprehension of the body is the non-apprehension of the tangible, which is the absence of a basis.

analyzed: manaḥ parijñā grāhya tā dharma anupalabdhiḥ an ālaya tā
translated: The non-apprehension of the mind is the non-apprehension of mental phenomena, which is the absence of a basis.

analyzed: evam tathāgatena a grāhya an ālayā bodhiḥ abhisaṃbuddhā
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata has realized enlightenment that is ungraspable and without a basis.

original: abhisaṃbudhya cakṣuṣo 'nanugrahāya rūpānupalabdhitaś cakṣurvijñānaṃ na pratiṣṭhitam /
analyzed: abhisaṃbudhya cakṣuṣaḥ nanugrahāya rūpa anupalabdhitaḥ cakṣuḥ vijñānam na pratiṣṭhitam
translated: Having realized it, the eye consciousness is not established due to the non-apprehension of form for the non-affliction of the eye.

original: śrotrānanugrahāya śabdānupalabdhitaḥ śrotravijñānaṃ na pratiṣṭhitam /🔽ghrāṇānanugrahāya gandhānupalabdhito ghrāṇavijñānaṃ na pratiṣṭhitam /
analyzed: śrotra ananugrahāya śabda anupalabdhitaḥ śrotra vijñānam na pratiṣṭhitam  ghrāṇa ananugrahāya gandha anupalabdhitaḥ ghrāṇa vijñānam na pratiṣṭhitam
translated: The ear consciousness is not established due to the non-apprehension of sound for the non-affliction of the ear.🔽The nose consciousness is not established due to the non-apprehension of smell for the non-affliction of the nose.

original: jihvānanugrahāya rasānupalabdhito jihvāvijñānaṃ na pratiṣṭhitam /🔽kāyānanugrahāya spraṣṭavyānupalabdhitaḥ
analyzed: jihvā ananugrahāya rasa anupalabdhitaḥ jihvā vijñānam na pratiṣṭhitam  kāya ananugrahāya spraṣṭavya anupalabdhitaḥ
translated: The tongue consciousness is not established due to the non-apprehension of taste for the non-affliction of the tongue.

analyzed: kāya vijñānam na pratiṣṭhitam
translated: The body consciousness is not established due to the non-apprehension of the tangible for the non-affliction of the body.

analyzed: manaḥ na anugrahāya dharma anupalabdhitaḥ manaḥ vijñānam na pratiṣṭhitam
translated: The mind consciousness is not established due to the non-apprehension of mental phenomena for the non-affliction of the mind.

original: tenāpratiṣṭhitavijñānas tathāgato 'rhan samyaksambuddha iti saṃkhyāṃ gacchati //
analyzed: tena apratiṣṭhita vijñānaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksambuddhaḥ iti saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One is reckoned as one whose consciousness is not established.

analyzed: catvāri imāni mañjuśrīḥ sattvānām citta pratiṣṭhāni
translated: Mañjuśrī, there are four things that are the bases of the minds of sentient beings.

original: katamāni catvāri yad uta rūpaṃ sattvānāṃ cittasya pratiṣṭhānam /
analyzed: katamāni catvāri yat uta rūpam sattvānām cittasya pratiṣṭhānam
translated: What are the four? They are: form is a basis of the minds of sentient beings.

original: evaṃ vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārā mañjuśrīḥ sattvānāṃ cittasya pratiṣṭhānam /
analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ mañjuśrīḥ sattvānām cittasya pratiṣṭhānam
translated: In the same way, Mañjuśrī, feeling, perception, and volitional factors are bases of the minds of sentient beings.

original: tāni khalu punar imāni mañjuśrīś catvāri cittasya pratiṣṭhānāni tathāgatenānutpannāny aniruddhānīti jñātāni //
analyzed: tāni khalu punar imāni mañjuśrīḥ catvāri cittasya pratiṣṭhānāni tathāgatena anutpannāni aniruddhāni iti jñātāni
translated: Moreover, Mañjuśrī, those four bases of the mind have been known by the Tathāgata to be unarisen and unceasing.

original: bodhir iti mañjuśrīḥ śūnyatāyā etad adhivacanam /
analyzed: bodhiḥ iti mañjuśrīḥ śūnyatāyāḥ etat adhivacanam
translated: Mañjuśrī, ‘awakening’ is a word for emptiness.

original: yayā śūnyatayā mañjuśrīr bodhiḥ śūnyā tayā śūnyatayā mañjuśrīḥ sarvadharmāḥ śūnyāḥ /
analyzed: yayā śūnyatayā mañjuśrīḥ bodhiḥ śūnyā tayā śūnyatayā mañjuśrīḥ sarva dharmāḥ śūnyāḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī, by that emptiness by which awakening is empty, Mañjuśrī, all dharmas are empty.

analyzed: te tathāgatena yathā eva śūnyāḥ tathā eva abhisaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: They have been fully awakened to by the Tathāgata just as they are empty.

analyzed: na mañjuśrīḥ śūnyatayā śūnyatā abhisaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī, emptiness is not fully awakened to by emptiness.

original: api tu khalu punar mañjuśrīr ekanayam etad yad uta śūnyatā vā bodhir vā /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar mañjuśrīḥ eka nayam etat yat uta śūnyatā vā bodhiḥ vā
translated: Moreover, Mañjuśrī, this is one principle, namely, emptiness or awakening.

original: yatra mañjuśrīr na śūnyatā na bodhiḥ /
analyzed: yatra mañjuśrīḥ na śūnyatā na bodhiḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī, where there is no emptiness and no awakening,

original: na tatra mañjuśrīḥ kiṃcid dvayaṃ yena dvayena śūnyatā vā bodhir vā dvidhākriyate /
analyzed: na tatra mañjuśrīḥ kiṃcid dvayam yena dvayena śūnyatā vā bodhiḥ vā dvidhākriyate
translated: Mañjuśrī, there is nothing dual there by which emptiness or awakening would be made twofold.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: advayā mañjuśrīḥ sarvadharmā alakṣaṇā advaidhīkārā anāmāno 'nimittāś cittamanovijñānāpagatā anutpannā aniruddhā
analyzed: advayāḥ mañjuśrīḥ sarva dharmāḥ alakṣaṇāḥ a dvaidhīkārāḥ anāmānaḥ nimittāḥ citta manaḥ vijñāna apagatāḥ an utpannāḥ a niruddhā
translated: Mañjuśrī, all phenomena are non-dual, without characteristics, not made twofold, nameless, signless, devoid of mind, thought, and consciousness, unborn, unceasing,

analyzed: an ācārāḥ a pracārāḥ a samudācārāḥ anakṣarāḥ a ghoṣāḥ
translated: without conduct, without activity, without manifestation, without letters, and without sound.

original: yat punar ucyate mañjuśrīḥ śūnyam iti /
analyzed: yat punar ucyate mañjuśrīḥ śūnyam iti
translated: Mañjuśrī, when it is said 'empty',

analyzed: an abhiniveśa grāhasya etat adhivacanam
translated: that is a designation for the non-apprehension of attachment.

original: na punar atra mañjuśrīḥ paramārthataḥ kaścid dharma upalabhyate yaḥ śūnyam ity ucyate /
analyzed: na punar atra mañjuśrīḥ paramārthataḥ kaścid dharmaḥ upalabhyate yaḥ śūnyam iti ucyate
translated: Moreover, Mañjuśrī, in the ultimate sense, no dharma whatsoever is apprehended here that is said to be empty.

original: yathā mañjuśrīr ākāśam ākāśam ity ucyate /
analyzed: yathā mañjuśrīḥ ākāśam ākāśam iti ucyate
translated: Mañjuśrī, just as space is said to be 'space',

analyzed: avacanīyam ākāśam
translated: space is inexpressible.

original: evam eva mañjuśrīḥ śūnyaṃ śūnyam ity ucyate /
analyzed: evam eva mañjuśrīḥ śūnyam śūnyam iti ucyate
translated: In the same way, Mañjuśrī, emptiness is said to be 'empty'.

analyzed: avacanīyeṣu śūnyeṣu praveśaḥ sarva dharmāṇām
translated: The entry into the inexpressible and empty is the entry into all phenomena.

original: anāmakā mañjuśrīḥ sarvadharmānām ataś ca vyākriyante /
analyzed: anāmakā mañjuśrīḥ sarva dharmānām atas ca vyākriyante
translated: Mañjuśrī, all phenomena are nameless, and therefore they are explained.

original: na mañjuśrīr nāma deśasthaṃ na pradeśasthaṃ /
analyzed: na mañjuśrīḥ nāma deśa stham na pradeśa stham
translated: Mañjuśrī, a name is not located in a place or a direction.

analyzed: tathā abhisaṃbuddhāḥ tathāgatena
translated: And thus they are fully awakened to by the Tathāgata.

original: nāmnā yo dharmo 'bhilapyate so 'pi dharmo na deśastho na pradeśasthaḥ /
analyzed: nāmnā yaḥ dharmaḥ bhilapyate saḥ pi dharmaḥ na deśa sthaḥ na pradeśa sthaḥ
translated: And that dharma which is designated by name, that dharma also is not located in a country or a region.

original: evam ete mañjuśrīḥ sarvadharmās tathāgatena jñātā ādita evājātā anutpannā aniruddhā alakṣaṇāś cittamanovijñānāpagatā anakṣarā aghoṣāḥ /
analyzed: evam ete mañjuśrīḥ sarva dharmāḥ tathāgatena jñātāḥ āditas eva a jātāḥ an utpannāḥ a niruddhāḥ alakṣaṇāḥ citta manaḥ vijñāna apagatāḥ anakṣarāḥ a ghoṣāḥ
translated: Thus, Mañjuśrī, all these dharmas are known by the Tathāgata from the very beginning as unborn, unarisen, unceased, without characteristics, devoid of mind, mentality, and consciousness, without letters, and without sound.

analyzed: yathā jñātāḥ tathā eva adhimuktāḥ
translated: They are known as they are, and thus they are believed in.

analyzed: na mañjuśrīḥ buddhaḥ dhimucyate
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Buddha does not believe.

analyzed: bodhiḥ mañjuśrīḥ ākāśa samā
translated: Mañjuśrī, enlightenment is equal to space.

analyzed: ākāśam ca na samam na
translated: And space is neither even nor

original: viṣamaṃ bodhir api na samā na viṣamā /
analyzed: viṣamam bodhiḥ api na samā na viṣamā
translated: uneven. Enlightenment is also neither even nor uneven.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yasya mañjuśrīr dharmasya na bhūtapariniṣpattir nāsau samo na viṣamo vā vaktavya iti /
analyzed: yasya mañjuśrīḥ dharmasya na bhūta pariniṣpattiḥ na asau samaḥ na viṣamaḥ vā vaktavyaḥ iti
translated: Mañjuśrī, that dharma which has no true ultimate completion should not be said to be even or uneven.

original: hi mañjuśrīs tathāgatena sarvadharmā asamā aviṣamā abhisaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: hi mañjuśrīḥ tathāgatena sarva dharmāḥ asamāḥ aviṣamāḥ abhisaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Thus, Mañjuśrī, all dharmas are fully awakened to by the Tathāgata as neither even nor uneven.

original: tathā cābhisaṃbuddhā athāṇur api na samīkṛto na viṣamīkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca abhisaṃbuddhāḥ atha aṇuḥ api na samīkṛtaḥ na viṣamīkṛtaḥ
translated: And thus they are fully awakened to, and then not even an atom is made even or uneven.🔽Dharmas are known just as they are,

original: yādṛśā eva te dharmāḥ tādṛśā eva vijñātāḥ /
analyzed: yādṛśāḥ eva te dharmāḥ tādṛśāḥ eva vijñātāḥ
translated: just as they are.

original: bhūtajñānena katamac ca mañjuśrīḥ sarvadharmā anutpannāniruddhāḥ /
analyzed: bhūta jñānena katamat ca mañjuśrīḥ sarva dharmāḥ anutpanna aniruddhāḥ
translated: With the knowledge of the elements, Mañjuśrī, all phenomena are unborn and unceasing.🔽They come into being without having been,

analyzed: a bhūtvā bhavanti  a bhūtvāḥ ca prati vigacchanti
translated: and having been, they disappear.

analyzed: te ca asvāmikāḥ aparigrahāḥ saṃbhavanti
translated: And they come into being without owners or possessors.

original: asvāmikā aparigrahāś ca mañjuśrīḥ prati vigacchanti /
analyzed: asvāmikāḥ aparigrahāḥ ca mañjuśrīḥ prati vigacchanti
translated: And Mañjuśrī, without owners or possessors, they disappear.

original: iti hi mañjuśrīḥ saṃbhavanti vibhavanti ca pratītya dharme vartante na cātra kaścid vartayitā /
analyzed: iti hi mañjuśrīḥ saṃbhavanti vibhavanti ca pratītya dharme vartante na ca atra kaścid vartayitā
translated: Thus, Mañjuśrī, they come into being and cease to be, they exist in dependence on phenomena, and yet there is no one here who makes them exist.

original: tad ucyate dharmopacchedāya tathāgato dharmaṃ deśayatīti //
analyzed: tat ucyate dharma upacchedāya tathāgataḥ dharmam deśayati iti

translated: Mañjuśrī, the Buddhas should not be seen in terms of form, nor in terms of the Dharma, nor in terms of characteristics, nor in terms of the dharmadhātu.

analyzed: na buddhāḥ ekākinaḥ na mahā jana madhya gatāḥ
translated: The Buddhas are not alone, nor are they in the midst of a great crowd.

analyzed: na buddhāḥ kenacid dṛṣṭāḥ
translated: The Buddhas have not been seen by anyone.

original: na śrutā na pūjitā na pūjyante /
analyzed: na śrutāḥ na pūjitāḥ na pūjyante
translated: They have not been heard, worshipped, or are not being worshipped.

original: na buddhā kasyacid dharmasya ekatvaṃ vā bahutvaṃ vā kurvanti /
analyzed: na buddhāḥ kasyacid dharmasya eka tvam vā bahu tvam vā kurvanti
translated: The Buddhas do not make any dharma one or many.

analyzed: na buddhaiḥ bodhiḥ prāptā
translated: Enlightenment has not been attained by the Buddhas.

analyzed: na buddhāḥ kenacid dharmena prabhāvyante
translated: The Buddhas are not manifested by any dharma.

original: na buddhaiḥ kaścid dharmo dṛṣṭo na śruto na smṛto na vijñāto nājñātaḥ /
analyzed: na buddhaiḥ kaścid dharmaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ na śrutaḥ na smṛtaḥ na vijñātaḥ na a jñātaḥ
translated: No dharma has been seen, heard, remembered, cognized, or known by the Buddhas.

original: na buddhair bhāṣitaṃ nodāhṛtam /🔽na buddhā bhāṣanti nodāharanti /
analyzed: na buddhaiḥ bhāṣitam na udāhṛtam  na buddhāḥ bhāṣanti na udāharanti
translated: No dharma has been spoken or uttered by the Buddhas.🔽The Buddhas do not speak or utter.

analyzed: na buddhāḥ bhāṣiṣyanti na udāhariṣyanti
translated: The Buddhas will not speak or utter.

analyzed: na buddhāḥ abhisaṃbudhyanti
translated: The Buddhas do not fully awaken.

analyzed: na buddhaiḥ kaścid dharmaḥ bhisaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: No dharma has been fully awakened to by the Buddhas.

analyzed: na buddhānām kleśāḥ prahīṇāḥ
translated: The afflictions of the Buddhas have not been abandoned.

analyzed: na vyavadānam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: The purified has not been realized.

analyzed: na buddhaiḥ kaścid dharmaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: No dharma has been seen by the Buddhas.

analyzed: na śrutaḥ na āghrātaḥ na vijñātaḥ
translated: It has not been heard, smelled, or cognized.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: ādi pariśuddha tvāt sarva dharmāṇām
translated: Because all dharmas are pure from the beginning.

original: yaḥ kaścin mañjuśrīr bodhisattvaḥ trisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamān sattvān pratyekajinatve sthāpayed idaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattvaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samān sattvān pratyeka jina tve sthāpayet idam dharmaparyāyam
translated: Mañjuśrī, if some bodhisattva were to establish beings equal in number to the atoms in a great trichiliocosm in the state of a pratyekabuddha,

analyzed: na adhimuktaḥ
translated: without being devoted to this Dharma discourse.

original: yo cānyo mañjuśrīr bodhisattva imaṃ dharmaparyāyam adhimucyet /
analyzed: yaḥ ca anyaḥ mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattvaḥ imam dharmaparyāyam adhimucyet
translated: And if another bodhisattva, Mañjuśrī, were to be devoted to this Dharma discourse,

analyzed: ayam tatas bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: this one would produce merit that is much greater than that.

original: kaḥ punar vādo ya imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ likhed lekhāpayed vā /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ yaḥ imam dharmaparyāyam likhet lekhāpayet vā
translated: How much more so for one who writes or causes to be written this Dharma teaching!

original: ayam eva tato bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati //
analyzed: ayam eva tatas bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: This one would produce even more merit than that.

original: yāvanto mañjuśrīr bodhisattva trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau sattvāḥ saṃvidyante /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattva tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau sattvāḥ saṃvidyante

analyzed: asaṃjñinaḥ vā

analyzed: a padā vā

analyzed: dvipadā vā

analyzed: catur padā vā

analyzed: bahu padā vā
translated: or with many feet,

analyzed: sarve te parikalpam upādāya

analyzed: apūrva acaramam mānuṣyakam ātma bhāvam pratilabheyuḥ

analyzed: mānuṣyakam ātma bhāvam pratilabhya bodhi cittam utpādayeyuḥ
translated: Having attained a human body, they would generate the mind of awakening.

original: bodhicittam utpādya ekaiko bodhisattvo gaṅgāsikatāsaṃkhyeyānāṃ buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamānāṃ

translated: the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and hearers with robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, medicine for curing the sick, and supplies.

analyzed: sarva sukha upadhānāni ca upasaṃharet
translated: And he would provide all the requisites for happiness.

analyzed: gaṅgāsikatā saṃkhyeyām kalpān
translated: For as many eons as there are sands in the Ganges,

analyzed: teṣām ca parinirvṛtānām stūpāni kārayet

analyzed: ratna mayāni

analyzed: yojana śata ucchritāni  ratna vedikā parivṛtāni
translated: one hundred yojanas high,🔽surrounded by jeweled terraces,

analyzed: maṇi muktā ratna dāma kṛta śobhāni  ucchrita chatra dhvaja patākāni
translated: adorned with garlands of jewels, pearls, and gems,🔽with raised parasols, banners, and flags,

analyzed: vaśi rāja maṇi ratna jāla saṃcchannāni

translated: having heard this Dharma discourse, the Ornament of the Light of Knowledge Entering the Domain of All Buddhas, would have faith in it, enter it, understand it, and realize it,

analyzed: antaśas ekām api gāthām uddiśet ayam saṃkhyeyataram puṇyam prasavet
translated: and at the very least, recite a single verse from it, this one would generate merit that is even more numerous than that.

analyzed: buddha jñāna anugamanam saṃvartakam asya puṇya abhisaṃskārasya
translated: It would lead to the knowledge of the Buddha.

analyzed: asya puṇya abhisaṃskārasya sa pūrvakaḥ puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ
translated: Compared to that merit, that previous merit🔽of those bodhisattvas, the accumulation of merit from generosity,🔽does not reach even a hundredth part,

original: teṣāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ dānamayaṃ puṇyakriyāvastu śatatamām api kalāṃ nopaiti /🔽sahasratamām api /🔽koṭīśatasahasratamām api /

translated: a thousandth part,🔽a hundred thousandth part,🔽a one with many zeros part,

translated: Even a comparison.

analyzed: upaniṣadam api na upaiti  yaḥ kaścid mañjuśrīḥ gṛhī bodhisattvaḥ gaṅgā sikatā saṃkhyeyān buddhān bodhisattvān sa śrāvaka saṃghān gaṅgā sikatā saṃkhyeyān
translated: Even an approximation does not reach it.

translated: Mañjuśrī, suppose some householder bodhisattva were to serve for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River buddhas, bodhisattvas, and their saṅgha of hearers with robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, and medicines for the sick and other necessary supplies.

original: yaś cānyaḥ pravrajito bodhisattvaḥ śīlavān āśayasaṃpanno 'ntaśo yas tiryagyonigate 'pi sattva ekasyāpy ālopaṃ dadyāt /

original: tasya puṇyābhisaṃskārasya pūrvakaḥ puṇyābhisaṃskāraḥ śatatamām api kalāṃ nopaiti /🔽sahasratamām api /🔽koṭīśatasahasratamām api /

translated: The previous creation of goodness would not even come close to a hundredth of the latter creation of goodness.🔽It would not even come close to a thousandth,🔽a hundred-thousandth,

analyzed: koṭī niyuta sahasratamām api
translated: a ten-millionth,

analyzed: yāvat upaniṣadam api na kṣamate
translated: or even an approximation.

original: sacen mañjuśrīs trisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamā bodhisattvāḥ pravrajitāḥ śīlavanta āśayaśuddhāḥ /
analyzed: saced mañjuśrīḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ bodhisattvāḥ pravrajitāḥ śīlavantaḥ āśaya śuddhāḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī, suppose bodhisattvas equal in number to the particles of dust in a great trichiliocosm were ordained, virtuous, and pure in attitude.

original: tata ekaiko bodhisattvo gaṅgānadīsikatāsaṃkhyeyān buddhān bodhisattvān saśrāvakasaṃghāṃś cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariskārair
analyzed: tatas ekaikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ gaṅgā nadī sikatā saṃkhyeyān buddhān bodhisattvān sa śrāvaka saṃghān cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariskāraiḥ
translated: Then, each bodhisattva would make offerings to as many buddhas, bodhisattvas, and assemblies of hearers as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river, with robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, remedies for exhaustion, and medicinal herbs.

analyzed: gaṅgā nadī sikatā saṃkhyeyān kalpān
translated: [This would be] for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river.

original: yas teṣāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ puṇyābhisaṃskāro bhaved dānamayaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ teṣām bodhisattvānām puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ bhavet dāna mayaḥ
translated: That would be the bodhisattvas' meritorious activity consisting of generosity.

original: yo vānyo bodhisattva āśayaśuddho śīlavān gṛhī vā pravrajito vā /
analyzed: yaḥ vā anyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āśaya śuddhaḥ śīlavān gṛhī vā pravrajitaḥ vā
translated: Or another bodhisattva, pure in intention, virtuous, whether a householder or one gone forth,

original: imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śrutvādhimucyet pattīyed vā likheta lekhāpayed vā /
analyzed: imam dharmaparyāyam śrutvā adhimucyet pattīyet vā likheta lekhāpayet vā
translated: having heard this Dharma discourse, would believe in it, understand it, write it, or have it written.

original: asya puṇyābhisaṃskārasya sa pūrvakaḥ puṇyābhisaṃskāraḥ /🔽teṣāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ dānamayaṃ puṇyakriyāvastu śatatamīm api kalāṃ nopaiti /

translated: Compared to that meritorious activity,🔽that meritorious activity consisting of the bodhisattvas' generosity🔽does not reach even a hundredth part,

analyzed: sahasratamīm api
translated: does not reach even a thousandth part,

analyzed: yāvat upaniṣām api na kṣamate
translated: does not reach even an ultimate part.

original: sacen mañjuśrīr bodhisattvo mahāsattvas trisāhasramahāsāhasraṃ lokadhātuṃ saptaratnaparipūrṇāṃ kṛtvā buddhebhyo bhagavadbhyo dānaṃ dadyāt
analyzed: saced mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasram lokadhātum sapta ratna paripūrṇām kṛtvā buddhebhyaḥ bhagavadbhyaḥ dānam dadyāt
translated: Mañjuśrī, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva were to fill the great trichiliocosm with the seven precious substances and give it as a gift to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

analyzed: evam dadan tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samān kalpān dānam dadyāt
translated: Thus giving gifts for eons equal to the number of atoms in the trichiliocosm.

original: yo vānyo bodhisattva imān dharmaparyāyān antaśaś catuṣpādikāṃ gāthāṃ bodhisattvasya deśayet /
analyzed: yaḥ vā anyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ imān dharmaparyāyān antaśas catuṣpādikām gāthām bodhisattvasya deśayet
translated: If another bodhisattva were to teach to a bodhisattva just one four-line verse from this Dharma teaching,

original: asya puṇyābhisaṃskārasya sa pūrvakaḥ puṇyābhisaṃskāraḥ śatatamām api kalāṃ nopaiti /🔽sahasratamām api /🔽śatasahasratamām api /
analyzed: asya puṇya abhisaṃskārasya sa pūrvakaḥ puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ śatatamām api kalām na upaiti  sahasratamām api  śata sahasratamām api
translated: then the previous accumulation of merit would not even come close to a hundredth part of this merit.🔽It would not even come close to a thousandth,🔽a hundred thousandth,

analyzed: koṭī śata sahasratamām api
translated: a hundred thousand koṭi-hundredth part,

analyzed: yāvat upaniṣām api na kṣamate
translated: up to it would not even stand up to a comparison.

original: tiṣṭhantu tāvan mañjuśrīḥ trisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamān kalpān dānaṃ dadataḥ puṇyābhisaṃskārāḥ /
analyzed: tiṣṭhantu tāvat mañjuśrīḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samān kalpān dānam dadataḥ puṇya abhisaṃskārāḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī, let alone giving gifts for as many eons as there are atoms in the trichiliocosm,

analyzed: saced mañjuśrīḥ gaṅgā sikatā saṃkhyeyāḥ bodhisattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī, if there were bodhisattvas equal in number to the sands of the Ganges River,

translated: and each bodhisattva were to prepare buddha-fields equal in number to the sands of the Ganges River, made of Jāmbū River gold,

analyzed: sarva vṛkṣān ca divyaiḥ vastraiḥ pariveṣṭayitvā
translated: and wrap all the trees with divine cloth,

analyzed: sarva prabhā samuccaya maṇi ratna jāla saṃcchannāni kṛtvā
translated: having made them covered with nets of all-shining, heaped-up jewel-gems,

analyzed: vaśi rāja maṇi ratna mayaiḥ kūṭāgāraiḥ vidyut pradīpa maṇi ratna vedikā parivṛtaiḥ paripūrṇām kṛtvā
translated: having filled them with palaces made of the jewel-gems of the king of gems, surrounded by altars of the jewel-gems of lightning-lamps,

translated: having raised up parasols, banners, and flags, he would give gifts day after day to Buddhas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

analyzed: evam dadaṅ gaṅgāsikatā saṃkhyeyān kalpān dānam dadyāt
translated: Giving gifts in this way for eons as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: yo vānyo bodhisattva imaṃ dharmaparyāyam adhimucyānyasya bodhisattvasyeto dharmaparyāyād antaśa ekām api catuṣpādikāṃ gāthāṃ deśayed avatārayed

translated: if another bodhisattva, having confidence in this Dharma teaching, were to teach even just one four-line verse from this Dharma teaching to another bodhisattva,🔽the previous accumulation of merit from the bodhisattvas' giving of gifts would not even come close to a hundredth part of this merit.

translated: It would not even come close to a thousandth part.🔽It would not even come close to a hundred-thousandth part.

analyzed: kalām api  gaṇanām api  upaniṣām api

analyzed: yaḥ vā anyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ pravrajitaḥ tiryagyoni gate sattve ekam ālopam dadyāt
translated: and if another ordained bodhisattva were to give just one morsel of food to a sentient being born as an animal,

analyzed: ayam tatas bahutaram asaṃkhyeyataram puṇyam prasavayāt
translated: the latter would generate merit that is much greater, incalculably greater, than the former.

original: sacen mañjuśrīr daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetrānabhilāpyakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraparamāṇurajaḥsamāḥ pravrajitā bodhisattvā bhaveyuḥ /
